required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Compliance of Parents of Children With Cerebral Palsy to Home Program Questionnaire
clinical_study.official_title: Psychometric Properties of Compliance of Parents of Children With Cerebral Palsy to Home Program Questionnaire

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the psychometric properties of the Compliance of Parents of Children with Cerebral Palsy to Home Program Assesment Questionnaire (CPHP-Q), a caregiver-report for adherence and frequency of home program implementation of parents of children with Cerebral Palsy.

primary_outcome.measure: Compliance of Parents of Children with Cerebral Palsy to Home Program Assesment Questionnaire (CPHP-Q)
primary_outcome.description: The CPHP-Q was administered as a caregiver-report questionnaire. It aims to measure home program adherence of parents of children with CP. İt consist of 22 items. The highest score 110, the lowest score 22.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Life Habits for Children questionnaire (LIFE-H)
secondary_outcome.description: The questionnaire was designed and validated to assess the social participation of children with disabilities. It consists of 11 category: nutrition, physical fitness, personal care, mobility, interpersonal communication, social roles, education, recreational activities, responsibilities, housing, and social life. Each Life-H item is ranked on a 0 to 9 scale for accomplishment, where a score of 0 represents "not accomplished" and a score of 9 equals "no difficulty and no assistance."

arm_group.arm_group_label: Compliance of Parents of Children with Cerebral Palsy to Home Program Assesment Questionnaire Group
arm_group.description: The CPHP-Q was administered as a caregiver-report questionnaire. It aims to measure home program adherence of parents of children with CP. Parents applied this instrument in the study.

intervention.description: To evaluate psychometric the properties of the Compliance of Parents of Children with Cerebral Palsy to Home Program Assesment Questionnaire (CPHP-Q), a caregiver-report for adherence and frequency of home program implementation of parents of children with Cerebral Palsy.
intervention.arm_group_label: Compliance of Parents of Children with Cerebral Palsy to Home Program Assesment Questionnaire Group

study_pop.textblock: Participants in the current study were parents of chlidren with 2 to 18 years and recruited at Hecettepe Univercity Physical Therapy and Rehabilitation Faculty Cerebral Palsy and Pediatric Rehabilitation Unit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. having a child with CP 2 to 18 years,
2. being a primary caregiver,
3. understanding of Turkish without an interpreter, and Turkish literacy,
Exclusion Criteria:
1. having any chronic illness or disability to prevent the home program,
2. haven't applied home program before.
